meanings.definition: The tendency of a plant or part of a plant to turn or grow in a certain direction in response to an external stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The sunflower's atropism caused it to lean towards the sunlight for nourishment.
meanings.sent2: The vine's atropism led it to twist around the trellis seeking support.
meanings.sent3: The atropism of the tree made it seem like it was reaching out for a hug from the neighboring plant.
meanings.sent4: The atropism of the ivy was like nature's way of creating a living sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The atropism of the daisy was so strong that it almost seemed like it was dancing in the wind.

meanings.definition: The act or process of exhibiting atropism.
meanings.sent1: The botanist studied the atropism of the flowers to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent2: Observing the atropism of the leaves helped the gardener determine the best placement for each plant.
meanings.sent3: The atropism of the cactus was so pronounced that it looked like it was trying to escape from its pot.
meanings.sent4: The atropism of the ferns in the forest created a mesmerizing natural display.
meanings.sent5: The atropism of the succulent was so unique that it became a topic of discussion among plant enthusiasts.
